info.title: Shared
info.description: A collection of shared API models used by the Open System repository

CommandSuccessResponse.title: CommandSuccessResponse
CommandSuccessResponse.description: A response returned from the server when data is successfully updated

RecordBase.title: RecordBase
RecordBase.description: The minimum model fields shared by all data stored in the database

Indexed.title: Indexed
Indexed.description: The minimum model fields shared by all data stored in the database

BaseProblemDetailsResponse.title: BaseProblemDetailsResponse
BaseProblemDetailsResponse.description: A base model for API errors inline with the [RFC 7807](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7807) specification.

Sample Response.title: An error occurred processing your request.
Sample Response.detail: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

title.example: You do not have enough credit.
title.default: An error occurred processing your request.
title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the pro**blem, except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see [RFC7231, Section 3.4](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231#section-3.4)).

detail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.
detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.default: An error occurred processing the request.

extendedDetail.example: Your current balance is 30, but that costs 50.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

severity.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

resultCode.description: The numeric message code related to this specific problem

resultType.description: The type of result code related to this specific problem

ProblemDetailsFieldResponse.title: ProblemDetailsFieldResponse
ProblemDetailsFieldResponse.description: Model containing validation details for a specific request field

type.description: A URI reference [RFC3986](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3986) that identifies the problem type. This specification encourages that, when dereferenced, it provide human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7807#ref-W3C.REC-html5-20141028)). When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be `about:blank`.

status.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the pro**blem, except for purposes of localization (e.g., using proactive content negotiation; see [RFC7231, Section 3.4](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7231#section-3.4)).

traceId.description: A unique Id representing the specific server request

stackTrace.description: The stack trade of the error

Address.title: Address
Address.description: Data used to specify a location

PagedResponse.title: PagedResponse
PagedResponse.description: A base response containing page data for a request

pageNumber.description: The current page number of the selected data

pageSize.description: The size of the current page

recordsTotal.description: The total number of records in the data set

recordsFiltered.description: The number of records filtered from the data set

UpdateResponse.description: A response returned from the server when data is successfully updated

pageNumber.name: pageNumber
pageNumber.description: The current page number of the selected data

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: The maximum amount of data to return in one request

orderBy.name: orderBy
orderBy.description: The field to order the request by

userId.name: userId
userId.description: The identifier of the current processing user

bearer-token.description: A request header containing the JSON web token (JWT) provided by the IDM service in a cookie when the user signed into the application. This JWT contains the current user's encoded `SiteMinder` entitlements.
